titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Orson Kinnear affidavit 1977.482
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:10:39 +0000.

did.abstract: A typed affidavit that serves as proof of the birth of Orson Kinnear in place of a birth certificate, and also verifies the identifies of Kinnear's parents and siblings. It is signed by a notary public in Durand, IL and dated December 14, 1940. Orson Kinnear (1864-1925) was born in Norfolk, St. Lawrence County, N.Y. to parents Kenneth and Celestia Kinnear and later resided in Durand, IL.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Orson Kinnear affidavit, 1977.482, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A typed affidavit that serves as proof of the birth of Orson Kinnear in place of a birth certificate, and also verifies the identifies of Kinnear's parents and siblings. It is signed by a notary public in Durand, IL and dated December 14, 1940.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Orson Kinnear (1864-1925) was born in Norfolk, St. Lawrence County, N.Y. to parents Kenneth and Celestia Kinnear and later resided in Durand, IL. He had two brothers, George Kinnear (d. 1950), who resided in Seattle, WA and was a steamboat engineer associated with the Alaska Steamship Company, and William H. Kinnear, who resided in Tenafly, N.J. and was a lawyer with offices in New York, N.Y.
